snippet: The voice of Ayman al-Zawahri, who has not had any confirmed audio or video communications since September, was identified in a message acknowledging the Taliban’s new leader.
abstract: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahri breaks nearly a year of silence to create audio message pledging allegiance to new Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour; al-Zawahri's message does not address Taliban's two-year delay in acknowledging death of former leader Mullah Muhammad Omar.
lead_paragraph: The voice of Ayman al-Zawahri, who has not had any confirmed audio or video communications since September, was identified in a message acknowledging the Taliban’s new leader.

headline.main: Message Believed to Be From Qaeda Leader Pledges Support for Taliban
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Chief Appears to End Silence in Message to Taliban
